title: > RuntimeError: VM Exception while processing transaction: out of gas
body:
Hi! I was impressed with buidler while working on a side project, so I'm experimenting with switching OpenZeppelin.

Here's my in-progress branch: https://github.com/shrugs/openzeppelin-solidity/tree/feat/buidler

I'm running our test suite (which uses a custom test script `scripts/test.sh` to set account balances very high) and running into a large suite of `out of gas` errors. I expect it's due to the change in how buidler dynamically calculates gas usage, where truffle just does the dumb "max gas" thing).

You can see a minimally reproducible case by running 

```bash
npm run test -- test/Bounty.test.js
```

Cheers, this is a great project.
Oop, I realize that in `test.sh` I'm using the `auto` network, not the `development`, so I'm still getting fund errors, but the out of gas errors don't change.

Hi Matt, I'm glad you are using buidler and could find a work around for this.

I suspect that it may be a problem in ganache's gas estimation.

I'm currently on vacations, but I'll get back to this in about a week.

Truffle Contracts doesn't estimate the gas before calling a function. 

I started working on this, but sometimes ganache estimates way less gas than necessary, and some tests are failing. You can take a look at it in [this branch](https://github.com/trufflesuite/truffle-contract/pull/95).

I'm closing this issue as it's no longer relevant.

We are releasing a beta version next month that always handles gas estimation automatically.
